required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Threatened Preterm Birth and Time of Subsequent Delivery -a Prediction Model
clinical_study.official_title: Threatened Preterm Birth and Time of Subsequent Delivery; Prediction Model Based on Biomarkers and Maternal/Obstetrical Characteristics

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates immunological and clinical markers in threatened preterm birth aiming to create a prediction model for preterm birth.

detailed_description.textblock:
Preterm birth is the main cause of neonatal mortality and morbidity and despite a lot of effort the mechanisms leading to preterm birth are poorly understood. In threatened preterm birth it is difficult to identify the true high risk cases ultimately leading to preterm birth. These women are often overtreated.
In this study blood samples are taken from women with threatened preterm birth and from women with normal pregnancies before and during labor.
Differences in clinical characteristics and immunological markers between the groups are studied in order to design a prediction model for preterm birth.

primary_outcome.description: Delivery before 34 weeks of gestation or after 34 weeks of gestation

arm_group.description: Women with either preterm labor or preterm prelabor rupture of the membranes. Blood samples taken at time of inclusion in the study.
Women with normal pregnancies. Blood samples taken at time of inclusion in the study, either prelabor (during pregnancy) or during active phase of labor.

biospec_descr.textblock: Plasma samples Serum samples RNA samples Placental biopsies

study_pop.textblock: 80 women with threatened preterm labor before 34 weeks of gestation, 40 women with preterm prelabor rupture of the membranes before 34 weeks of gestation, 40 women with normal pregnancies in labor at term, 44 women with normal pregnancies during pregnancy (before labor)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Threatened preterm birth before 34 weeks of gestation; either threatened preterm labor and/or preterm prelabor rupture of the membranes
- Age > 18 years
- Swedish-speaking (understanding study information)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple gestation
- Blood borne infections

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Linköping University, Linköping, Sweden
